source.cc61301c:
#Intro
print("Flow Chart: Did you eat yet? *Chinese/Mexican food edition*")
#Initial Question
hungry = input("Are you hungry? (yes, no)")
#If yes
if hungry == "yes":
    eaten = input("Have you eaten in the last 30 minutes? (yes, no)")
    if eaten == "yes":
        print("Eat a snack")
        #End
    else:
        #Choice between Chinese, Mexican, or Neither
        Choice = input("Which one are you craving more? Chinese or Mexican food? (Chinese, Mexican, or Neither)")
        if Choice == "Neither":
        #Chose Neither
            print("Damn, call your mom for help then.")
            #End
        elif Choice == "Chinese":
        #Chose Chinese
            chicken = input("Do you like chicken? (yes, no)")
            #If yes
            if chicken == "yes":
                orange = input("Do you like the flavor of oranges? (yes, no)")
                if orange == "yes":
                #If yes
                    print("Eat some Orange Chicken")
                    #End
                else:
                #If no
                    brocolli = input("Do you like Brocolli? (yes, no)")
                    if brocolli == "yes":
                    #If yes
                        print("Eat some Broccoli Chicken")
                        #End
                    else:
                    #If no
                        noodles = input("Like noodles? (yes, no)")
                        if noodles == "yes":
                        #If yes
                            print("Eat some Chicken Lo Mein")
                            #End
                        else:
                        #If no
                            print("Call your mom for help.")
                            #End
            #If no
            else:
                crab = input("You like Crab? (yes, no)")
                if crab =="yes":
                #If yes
                    print("Eat some Crab Ragoon")
                    #End
                else:
                #If no
                    noodlesPt2 = input("You like noodles? (yes, no)")
                    if noodlesPt2 == "yes":
                    #If yes
                        print("Eat some Lo Mein")
                        #End
                    else:
                    #If yes
                        print("Call your mom for help.")
                        #End
                
        elif Choice == "Mexican":
        #Chose Mexican
            taco = input("Do you like Tacos? (yes, no)")
            if taco == "yes":
            #If yes
                print("Eat some Tacos")
                #End
            else:
            #If no
                burrito = input("Damn, What about burritos? (yes, no)")
                if burrito == "yes":
                #If yes
                    print("Eat some Burritos")
                    #End
                else:
                #If no
                    Carne = input("Not that either?! What about Carne Asada? (yes, no)")
                    if Carne == "yes":
                    #If yes
                        print("Eat some Carne Asada")
                        #End
                    else:
                    #If no
                        print("Call your mom for help then.")
                        #End
#If no
else:
    sure = input("Are you sure? (yes, no)")
    #if Yes
    if sure == "yes":
        print("Go do something then.")
        #End
    #If no
    else:
        eaten2 = input("Have you eaten in the last 30 minutes? (yes, no)")
    if eaten2 == "yes":
        print("Eat a snack")
        #End
    else:
        #Choice between Chinese, Mexican, or Neither
        Choice2 = input("Which one are you craving more? Chinese or Mexican food? (Chinese, Mexican, or Neither)")
        if Choice2 == "Neither":
        #Chose Neither
            print("Damn, call your mom for help then.")
            #End
        elif Choice2 == "Chinese":
        #Chose Chinese
            chicken2 = input("Do you like chicken? (yes, no)")
            #If yes
            if chicken2 == "yes":
                orange2 = input("Do you like the flavor of oranges? (yes, no)")
                if orange2 == "yes":
                #If yes
                    print("Eat some Orange Chicken")
                    #End
                else:
                #If no
                    brocolli2 = input("Do you like Brocolli? (yes, no)")
                    if brocolli2 == "yes":
                    #If yes
                        print("Eat some Broccoli Chicken")
                        #End
                    else:
                    #If no
                        noodles2 = input("Like noodles? (yes, no)")
                        if noodles2 == "yes":
                        #If yes
                            print("Eat some Chicken Lo Mein")
                            #End
                        else:
                        #If no
                            print("Call your mom for help.")
                            #End
            #If no
            else:
                crab2 = input("You like Crab? (yes, no)")
                if crab2 =="yes":
                #If yes
                    print("Eat some Crab Ragoon")
                    #End
                else:
                #If no
                    noodlesPt2no2 = input("You like noodles? (yes, no)")
                    if noodlesPt2no2 == "yes":
                    #If yes
                        print("Eat some Lo Mein")
                        #End
                    else:
                    #If yes
                        print("Call your mom for help.")
                        #End
                
        elif Choice2 == "Mexican":
        #Chose Mexican
            taco2 = input("Do you like Tacos? (yes, no)")
            if taco2 == "yes":
            #If yes
                print("Eat some Tacos")
                #End
            else:
            #If no
                burrito2 = input("Damn, What about burritos? (yes, no)")
                if burrito2 == "yes":
                #If yes
                    print("Eat some Burritos")
                    #End
                else:
                #If no
                    Carne2 = input("Not that either?! What about Carne Asada? (yes, no)") 
                    if Carne2 == "yes":
                    #If yes
                        print("Eat some Carne Asada")
                        #End
                    else:
                    #If no
                        print("Call your mom for help then.")
                        #End
source.1acee52f:
Im gonna make a Flowchart. I wrote the draft on paper, so im gonna write the intro.
It's called "Did you eat yet?" and starts off with "Are you hungry" and goes on from there.
source.1e11a4d1:
Requirement Description Points Earned
Originality All code is your own. Any code snippets that are not your own are properly cited. No more than 5 lines from any website. 10 points 10
Planning & Reflection The "make a plan" section includes a detailed description of how you plan to complete the project. Reflection is thoughtful and answers all required questions. 10 points 10
Compiles Code Compiles 10 points 5
Comments Code is properly commented 10 points 10
Conventions Naming and style conventions are approriate 10 points 7
More Planning Your planning includes a decision tree and pesudocode 10 points 10
Results There are at least 5 unique results. 10 points 10
Options At least 2 questions have more than two choices 10 points 10
No Nonsense The end result is based on answers to previous questions and makes sense. 10 points 10
if, elif, else if, elif, and else are all used when approriate 10 points 10
--- "Final" Score: 92/ 100 * It breaks if I say that I am not hungry and that I am sure, because ```eaten2``` is not defined. * Watch your language please :) * I like that you ask the 'are you sure?' question, but it requires you to type everything twice, which is not great. Consider using a while loop when we get to it * Can you show me you on paper planning please? * A little over-commented. Using end is common, but you don't necessarily need the ```#if yes``` and ```#If no``` comments. The programmer should be able to figure that out. ---
